Personal Portfolio:

This is my personal portfolio, which was designed and developed by myself. I used various different tools to create the final product.

The technologies/languages used are as followed:
- HTML.
- CSS.
- SCSS.
- JavaScript.
- Moqups (Online Mockup, Wireframe and UI Prototyping Tool).
- VSCode.
- Photoshop.

This website was developed after the completion of 'Responsive Web Design', 'JavaScript Algorithms' and 'Front-End Libraries' units in FreeCodeCamp. I decided to put my knowledge of HTML, CSS and JavaScript to the test and my end product is the website you're currently browsing. My portfolio website has recently been updated, incorporating SASS workflow, allowing to keep things more organised and creating style sheets much more efficiently.

Tru Burger:

This is a website that I designed as a revamp for Tru Burger's existing website. I chose this specific website because I often go here to eat, familiar with the staff and etc; therefore, I felt like it would be the most appropriate website to remake.

The technologies/languages used are as followed:
- HTML.
- CSS.
- JavaScript.
- Moqups (Online Mockup, Wireframe and UI Prototyping Tool).
- VSCode.
- Photoshop.

×

COVID-19 Tracker:

After completing the FreeCodeCamp units on React, I decided to create an application in React which tracked all the Covid-19 cases, including: people infected, people recovered and deaths occuring from covid-19. This app uses information from an api I found online, converting it from JSON format to readable data, which is displayed as a graph. Alot of features from React had been used, such as React Hooks i.e. useState, useEffect and etc.

The technologies/languages used are as followed:
- HTML.
- CSS.
- JavaScript.
- JSX
- React
- MaterialUI
- Axios
- ChartJs
- VSCode.

×

Mobiles R Us:

An e-commerce web application developed via React - Context API. It was heavily focused on understanding how an e-commerce website operates and the functionality it consists of. After creating this application, I have understood how a web application can boost business sales by just allowing customers to complete their purchase online â€“ leading to a repeat sale for the business.

The e-commerce web application was developed with a mobile first approach. Bootstrap was used in order to set styling to each component, as well as being mobile responsive. The web application is responsive in all sizes, from XL displays to XS displays.

The technologies/languages used are as followed:
- HTML.
- CSS.
- JavaScript.
- JSX
- React - Context API
- Bootstrap
- Styled Components
- Node.js
- VSCode.

×

Beach Resort:

A Web application developed via React. After completing 2 previous projects in React, I wanted a better grasp of how components work in React as well as an alternative to Redux for state management. This project portrays my current skill set in React. You are able to filter rooms by different search parameters, from price to the exact room size needed. The main goal in creating this project was to get an in depth understanding of React, especially the Context API - how it manages global application state in the React app.

Furthermore, in order to get the project live, Contentful was used. This allowed me to easily create, manage and publish content to my live website. I chose this route because it was less time consuming compared to wiring up my own backend in order to manage the content. Contentful made the whole process of publishing my website with any updates much more time efficient.

The technologies/languages used are as followed:
- HTML.
- CSS.
- JavaScript.
- JSX
- React - Context API
- Styled Components
- Node.js
- VSCode.

×

Netflix:

A Netflix clone developed using React, including React Hooks. This project was created to get a lot of use with react hooks when managing state. The 2 hooks that were predominantly used are: useState and useEffect. "useState" was used in order to store the state to later manipualte it. In order to store the initial state and later modify it, useState hook allowed me to use it inside the existing function component, rather than coverting it to a class component. "useEffect" hook allowed me to replace all component lifecycle methods with this one hook.

Furthermore, in order to get the project live, Firebase was used. This allowed me to easily create, manage and publish content to my live website. I chose this route because it was less time consuming compared to wiring up my own backend in order to manage the content. Firebase made the whole process of publishing my website with any updates much more time efficient.

The technologies/languages used are as followed:
- HTML.
- CSS.
- JavaScript.
- JSX
- React - React Hooks
- Node.js
- VSCode.
- Firebase
